content: Hi everyone, I have a hypothetical scenario to put forward. Suppose one used to think that he/she was gay, and that one had sought therapy to help resolve this matter. The therapy lasts about a month and is terminated by the patient--no diagnoses are made and no medicine is prescribed--but there is still, within those mental health records, written evidence that the patient had the propensity to engage in homosexual conduct. Two years later, this person, who is no longer curious about same-sex attractions and leads a straight lifestyle, wants to enlist. At MEPS he or she will have to produce records of ALL therapy, and the doctor will discover evidence of homosexual behavior and relations. Is this disqualifying for entry? Even if this evidence only pertains to prior homosexual conduct, and they sign off or swear to being straight? Or is this a barrier to enlistment/commission?
reply: Hi everyone, I have a hypothetical scenario to put forward. Suppose one used to think that he/she was gay, and that one had sought therapy to help resolve this matter. The therapy lasts about a month and is terminated by the patient--no diagnoses are made and no medicine is prescribed--but there is still, within those mental health records, written evidence that the patient had the propensity to engage in homosexual conduct. Two years later, this person, who is no longer curious about same-sex attractions and leads a straight lifestyle, wants to enlist. At MEPS he or she will have to produce records of ALL therapy, and the doctor will discover evidence of homosexual behavior and relations. Is this disqualifying for entry? Even if this evidence only pertains to prior homosexual conduct, and they sign off or swear to being straight? Or is this a barrier to enlistment/commission?
title: Looking for certain testimonies

content: quote: Originally posted by NEMESIS1960: opened so cutter can splain himself have at it cutter Don't know about cutter, but....I can say that I know of NO violations of the UCMJ during my service. My security clearance was TS-SI and I can't imagine ANY part of my background and ongoing behavior that wasn't under constant scrutiny!
quote: Originally posted by NEMESIS1960: opened so cutter can splain himself have at it cutter
reply: Don't know about cutter, but....I can say that I know of NO violations of the UCMJ during my service. My security clearance was TS-SI and I can't imagine ANY part of my background and ongoing behavior that wasn't under constant scrutiny!
